title: Giants turn tables on Eagles with complete home victory
content: The Giants started fast, fell behind, then dominated the second half to take down their hated division rivals.

title: Jets LB Johnson to play after missing 3 games
content: Jets edge rusher Jermaine Johnson, who missed three games with an ankle injury, will play Sunday against the Broncos at London's Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

title: Sister Jean, beloved Loyola-Chicago chaplain, dies
content: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the longtime chaplain of the Loyola-Chicago men's basketball team, died Thursday at the age of 106. "[She] was an invaluable source of wisdom and grace for generations of students, faculty, and staff," the school said.

title: Eagles RT Johnson calls for 'less predictable' attack
content: Eagles right tackle Lane Johnson said the offense needs to work hard to "keep defenses guessing" after Thursday night's 34-17 loss to the Giants.

title: Dodgers advance to NLCS after Kerkering's error
content: The Dodgers beat the Phillies 2-1 on Thursday to advance to the NLCS. The Phillies' Orion Kerkering made a wild throw past home instead of throwing to first after mishandling a bases-loaded comebacker with two outs in the 11th inning.

title: Dart, Giants hope win over Eagles shifts narrative
content: Jaxson Dart led the Giants to a convincing 34-17 win over the Eagles on Thursday night, a victory that they hope begins to change the perception of the team, which went 3-14 last season.

title: Boyd, Happ atone for struggles as Cubs force G5
content: The Cubs got a lift from two struggling players Thursday night, as starter Matthew Boyd and left fielder Ian Happ helped set the tone in a 6-0 Game 4 victory over the Brewers.

title: LeBron out 3-4 weeks, set to miss Lakers opener
content: Lakers star LeBron James will be sidelined an additional three to four weeks because of sciatica on his right side, the team announced Thursday.

title: Ex-Fins safety Jones awarded $9.5M in fraud suit
content: Former Dolphins safety Reshad Jones has settled a lawsuit against Merrill Lynch for $9.5 million after a former financial adviser allegedly stole $2.59 million from the two-time Pro Bowler.

title: 📸 Reese to walk Victoria's Secret show runway
content: The Chicago Sky star will make history as the first professional athlete to walk in the fashion show.

title: Digging in on 31 tasty morsels from a full Week 7 menu
content: New features Indiana-Oregon and Alabama-Missouri mix with standbys such as Oklahoma-Texas this weekend.

title: Our guide to every Week 6 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Here's everything you need to know for Week 6 NFL games. Which teams will win, who are the X factors, and which storylines matter most?

title: QB musical chairs? Why the AFC North is struggling at the premier position
content: It's a bizarre time in the division with Aaron Rodgers the only starting QB who began 2025 in that capacity.

title: Pain, rehab and unlikely inspiration: Inside Aidan Hutchinson's return to dominance
content: Hutchinson's long journey back from a broken leg found inspiration from children whom he has inspired, too.

title: WWE Crown Jewel preview: Rollins-Rhodes, Cena tour stop, more
content: As WWE Crown Jewel heads to Perth, Western Australia, we break down the biggest storylines, including John Cena's retirement tour.

title: Four ways LeBron James' unprecedented 23rd NBA season could go
content: Retirement? Re-up with the Lakers? Request a trade? Here are the various pathways for LeBron and the Lakers for the 2025-26 campaign.

title: Facing must-win Game 5, why Seattle's other MVP will be crucial to Mariners' chances
content: While the world watched Cal Raleigh's rise, Julio Rodriguez took another step in his evolution as a superstar.

title: How Mariners, Tigers can win decisive Game 5
content: Will Detroit secure the win in Seattle to advance to the ALCS or will the Mariners move on to face Toronto?

title: 'It'll only be right to win at least one World Series for him': Can Yankees build championship team around Aaron Judge?
content: After another October exit, the Yankees captain turns 34 in April. Here's what we know -- and don't know -- about next year in the Bronx.

title: How to fix Man United in four steps (with some help from Liverpool, Arsenal and Man City)
content: Man United haven't had sustained Premier League success in more than a decade. Here's what they need to do, by following the playbooks of Liverpool, Arsenal and Man City.

title: The race to be No. 9: Which strikers will the USMNT take to the World Cup?
content: The USMNT's history of productive strikers is limited, but ahead of the World Cup, several are in the form of their lives. So who will make the team?

title: How Oregon's Dante Moore, Indiana's Fernando Mendoza became unlikely NFL darlings
content: An under-the-radar three-star and a seemingly forgotten five-star, Mendoza and Moore are rising up draft boards.

title: Reid's debut NFL draft QB Hot Board for 2026
content: Who are the best quarterbacks in class? We ranked the top 14, including some playing each other this week.

title: The NBA's next Chosen One will be ... tough to predict: Five paths the face of the league could follow
content: ESPN analyst Zach Kram explores the players who could follow in Steph Curry's and LeBron James' footsteps.

title: No gap year here: Celtics, Pacers approach season without leaders
content: Despite injuries to Tyrese Haliburton and Jayson Tatum, the Pacers and Celtics are still in 'win now' mode.

title: Wetzel: Why college basketball coaches can watch more football in 2025
content: The NCAA's stalled 5-in-5 rule has put a hold on much of college basketball recruiting until next spring.

title: NHL breakout tiers: From Nazar to Snuggerud to Peterka, players set to level up
content: From players with new linemates to young stars set to hit superstardom to enticing rookies, watch out for this group.

title: 75 stadiums, 45 states, one vision: Why the Savannah Bananas' next step is their biggest yet
content: The Savannah Bananas prepare for a new era of bodacious baseball. Check out what "Banana Ball" is doing next.

title: Don't be surprised if... McMillan finds end zone, Judkins finishes top 3 in rushing
content: Week 6 storylines include a pair of impressive rookies, and is the Mayfield/Egbuka connection sustainable?

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 6
content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks, plus projected scores for every game.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Mateusz Gamrot end Charles Oliveira unbeaten streak in Brazil?
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the UFC Fight Night Rio main event, and Ian Parker gives value picks for the card.

title: 'You're just poking the bear': Bucs' Wirfs recalls fan heckling Baker in Seattle
content: Buccaneers left tackle Tristan Wirfs witnessed Baker Mayfield's trash-talking exchange with a Seattle Seahawks fan last Sunday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to return for Juve's Yildiz
content: Chelsea are lining up another approach for Juventus' Kenan Yildiz. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: College football best bets for Week 7: Why an 0-5 team should be on your bet slip
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 7 of the college football season, including what makes UMass-Kent State a solid game to bet.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Packers, Broncos among top options in Week 6
content: Predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 6, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Rookie draft guide: How early to pick Cooper Flagg, Dylan Harper and eight others
content: What fantasy managers can expect from the best rookies this season and how they should be viewed in drafts.

title: Kabul bombing: Taliban terms it 'provocative act' by Pak; sends big warning from Indian soil
content: Afghanistan's Taliban government has accused Pakistan of bombing a border town and violating its sovereignty, following explosions in Kabul.  Meanwhile, India and Afghanistan declared Pakistan-sponsored cross-border terrorism a shared threat.  New Delhi will upgrade its technical mission in Kabul to an embassy, and Kabul assured India it won't allow its territory to be used against Indian interests.

title: 'I tried committing suicide': Cricketer reveals gory details - Watch
content: Tazmin Brits has made an extraordinary comeback to cricket after a serious car accident. Her determination and a chance encounter with a provincial coach paved her way back. Brits' brilliant century against New Zealand in the World Cup solidified her as a key player, showcasing her resilience and ability to perform under pressure.

title: 'In shock!’ Nobel Peace Prize winner Maria Machado reacts
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado expressed shock and joy upon learning of her Nobel Peace Prize win. The committee recognized her unwavering efforts for democratic rights and a peaceful transition from dictatorship.

title: Microsoft engineer quits: emails thousands of staff; says can't enable war
content: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: Pak violence over pro-Palestine march: 2 killed, 50 wounded in clashes in Lahore
content: Violent clashes erupted in Lahore as police used batons and tear gas to stop thousands of Islamist protesters from marching towards Islamabad. The TLP organization claims two supporters died and 50 were injured since Thursday. Authorities have blocked roads and cut internet services to prevent the demonstration.

title: BMW India achieves best-ever sales with GST 2.0 boost: iX1 top EV model
content: BMW Group India has recorded its best-ever January-September performance, selling 11,978 cars with a 13% rise. The July-September quarter saw a significant 21% jump. Demand for long wheelbase models and SUVs surged, while electric vehicle sales exploded by 246%, making EVs 21% of total car sales. BMW Motorrad also saw robust motorcycle sales.

title: More problems for Nvidia: China asks cos to stop ordering; tightens customs rules
content: China is intensifying scrutiny on chip imports at major ports, reportedly to curb the use of US products like Nvidia's AI processors. Customs officials are conducting stringent checks on semiconductor shipments, expanding beyond initial targets to include all advanced chips to prevent smuggling that violates US export controls.

title: 'Contiguous neighbour': EAM calls Pak 'threat' for India and Afghanistan; sends clear message on PoK
content: India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlighted Pakistan-sponsored cross-border terrorism as a shared threat during talks with Afghan counterpart Amir Khan Muttaqi. He stressed coordinated efforts against terrorism, noting Afghanistan's sensitivity to India's security concerns. Muttaqi affirmed Afghanistan's commitment against elements threatening others and praised India's humanitarian aid.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
content: Google is tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, separate from the existing hybrid schedule, aims to prevent WFA from substituting regular remote work. Employees are also restricted from using WFA days to work from other Google offices due to legal and financial concerns.

title: IND vs WI: Unbeaten Jaiswal 173; India reach 318/2 at stumps on Day 1
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal scored an unbeaten 173 runs on day one of the second Test against West Indies. India reached 318 runs for the loss of two wickets. Jaiswal shared a significant partnership with Sai Sudharsan. India aims for a series clean sweep. The West Indies team seeks to avoid another whitewash.

title: 'Will expand circle of peace': Netanyahu says Israeli forces remain in Gaza until Hamas disarms
content: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced an expansion of peace efforts as a ceasefire with Hamas commenced. He stated that hostages would be returned soon and Israeli forces would remain in Gaza to ensure Hamas disarms. Thousands of displaced Palestinians began returning home following the agreement, which was facilitated by talks in Egypt and a US peace plan.

title: 'Trained engineer': Venezuela's Machado wins Nobel Peace Prize - what’s her academic background?
content: María Corina Machado, a Venezuelan industrial engineer and opposition leader, has won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her relentless fight for democracy against authoritarian rule. Her journey from academia to activism reflects a fusion of technical precision and civic courage. Founder of Súmate and leader of Vente Venezuela, Machado has endured persecution, exile, and political bans. Her engineering mindset underpins her approach to governance, showing that democracy, like any system, requires constant, principled maintenance.

title: Nobel snub: Donald Trump misses out on Peace Prize - why he lost
content: Venezuelan pro-democracy leader Maria Corina Machado has been awarded the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her unwavering fight against Nicolás Maduro's regime and her advocacy for free elections. The committee's decision, made prior to any recent geopolitical events, firmly excludes US President Donald Trump, who had expressed expectations for the award. Machado's courage in the face of persecution inspires millions.

title: Alexis Ohanian recalls mom’s deportation fears as ICE raids tear families apart
content: Alexis Ohanian, husband of Serena Williams, spoke out against recent ICE arrests, sharing his personal connection as the son of an undocumented immigrant. He emphasized the importance of "smart borders and humane immigration reform" that includes a fair legalization plan, rather than breaking up families.

title: Todd McLellan slams Red Wings after fans boo team off the ice
content: Detroit Red Wings' home opener was a dismal 5-1 defeat to Montreal, drawing boos from frustrated fans. New coach Todd McLellan accepted the criticism, demanding accountability for defensive lapses and poor execution. He stressed the need for disciplined, fundamentally sound hockey, not just effort, as the team prepares to regroup and face Toronto.

title: Watch: Patna metro station filled with gutka stains in 3 days
content: Barely days after its inauguration, Patna Metro stations are already marred by red gutka stains. A viral video highlights the widespread vandalism, with walls, stairs, and platforms defaced. A frustrated citizen expressed dismay at the public's disregard for the new infrastructure, questioning civic sense.

title: Russell Wilson benched vs Eagles: Giants QB’s emotional message to wife Ciara
content: The New York Giants have benched veteran quarterback Russell Wilson for Jaxson Dart in their Week 6 game against the Eagles, marking Wilson's third consecutive game on the sidelines due to performance issues. Despite professional challenges, Wilson finds strength in his family, including wife Ciara and their children, and remains ready to contribute if called upon.

title: RBI realtime cheque clearance : Customers complain, bank staff not fully trained
content: India's new real-time cheque clearance system is experiencing initial problems. Bank staff are facing challenges with new processes, and technical glitches are slowing down cheque processing. Customers report delays in payments. The Reserve Bank of India is working to resolve these issues. The system aims for same-day clearance, replacing older methods. Bankers expect smooth operations soon.

title: McDavid faces backlash for blunt comments on young players after extension
content: Connor McDavid has signed a two-year, $25 million extension with the Edmonton Oilers, accepting below-market value to prioritize winning now.  His decision reflects the team's limited youth due to past trades, creating a tight window for a Stanley Cup.  General Manager Stan Bowman highlighted McDavid's team-first approach, emphasizing the immediate goal of championship contention.

title: In Sabarimala gold theft, a Vijay Mallya connection
content: Pandalam Palace representatives are demanding a thorough investigation into how gold sheets, gifted by Vijay Mallya in 1998 for the Sabarimala Dwarapalaka idol, allegedly turned non-gold by 2019. They question the capability of repair sponsors and the negligence in procedures, urging accountability for those involved in the temple's upkeep.

title: China-US tensions: Beijing hits US ships with ‘special port fees’
content: China will implement "special port fees" on US-built or operated ships starting October 14, with charges of 400 yuan per net tonne. This retaliatory measure mirrors US port fees imposed on Chinese vessels, aiming to protect Chinese shipping companies' interests. Beijing urges Washington to reverse its actions.

title: Son of Pulwama martyr, Rahul selected for Haryana U19; Sehwag: 'It has been my privilege'
content: Rahul Soreng, whose father died in the Pulwama attack, has been selected for the Haryana Under-19 cricket team. Former Indian opener Virender Sehwag congratulated Rahul. Sehwag International School provides free education and boarding for children of martyrs. Rahul has been studying at the school since 2019. This selection marks a significant achievement for Rahul and his family.

title: Kantara: Chapter 1' box office collection day 9( LIVE): film crosses Rs 340 crore
content: Rishab Shetty's "Kantara: A Legend Chapter 1" is a box office sensation, raking in ₹336.50 crore in just eight days, becoming the second highest-grossing film of 2025. It has surpassed the original "Kantara's" lifetime earnings and is now chasing the ₹500 crore mark. The film faces no significant competition, ensuring its continued dominance.

title: 'Committed to sovereignty': Jaishankar meets Afghan FM; India to reopen embassy in Kabul
content: India is upgrading its Technical Mission in Kabul to an embassy, signaling a renewed commitment to Afghanistan's sovereignty and regional stability. External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlighted cooperation in mining and trade, while Afghanistan's Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi pledged not to allow Afghan territory for anti-India activities, emphasising mutual respect and people-to-people ties.

title: 'Traffic means growth': Priyank Kharge's bizarre justification for Bengaluru jams
content: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge views Bengaluru's traffic congestion as a positive indicator of economic growth, attributing it to the city's booming job market and influx of migrants. He highlighted significant office space absorption and a large vehicle count, suggesting these are symptoms of a thriving economy that needs to be managed.

title: Where women want to work in India: AP, Kerala Gujarat lead; top 10 list here
content: The India Skills Report 2025 by Wheebox reveals the top 10 Indian states where women prefer to work, highlighting growing employability trends and regional preferences. Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, and Maharashtra lead the list. The report underscores how safety, infrastructure, and career opportunities shape women’s workplace choices and guide employers’ diversity strategies.

title: Bihar polls: 17 EBC, 11 OBC, 9 general, 7 Muslims in Jan Suraaj's 1st list
content: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj party unveiled its first 51 candidates for Bihar polls, prioritizing individuals from non-political backgrounds. The list features doctors, academics, retired officers, a singer, and Karpoori Thakur's granddaughter, aiming to offer a fresh alternative. Caste equations were considered, with representation from EBC, OBC, general, and Muslim communities, alongside women and a transgender candidate.

title: Did Raja Jackson plead guilty to assault charges? UFC legend’s son faces jail time
content: Raja Jackson, son of UFC legend Rampage Jackson, has pleaded not guilty to felony battery charges following a violent assault on pro-wrestler Syko Stu. The incident, which occurred at an independent wrestling event, resulted in Stu sustaining serious injuries. Jackson faces potential imprisonment, with a preliminary hearing scheduled.

title: Trump seeks fair play! US asks China to not fly over Russia
content: The US government has proposed barring Chinese airlines from flying over Russia on routes to and from the United States, citing unfair competitive advantages. This move aims to level the playing field for American carriers, which lost access to Russian airspace after the Ukraine invasion. The proposal could impact major Chinese airlines and adds to existing US-China economic tensions.

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal scripts history, joins elite list of cricket legends
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's magnificent century dominated the opening day against the West Indies, propelling India to a commanding position. His seventh Test hundred before 24 places him among cricketing legends. Jaiswal's consistent opening prowess outshines all others since his debut, solidifying his status as a rising star.

title: Cough syrup deaths: SC rejects PIL seeking CBI probe, drug safety review; toll at 21 in MP
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed a plea for a CBI investigation into the deaths of children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. These deaths were reportedly caused by a toxic cough syrup. The manufacturer's owner has been arrested. Several states have banned the syrup, and the factory has been sealed.

title: Noida horror: Man kills dhaba worker who refused to pack late-night food order
content: A dhaba worker was beaten to death in Gaur City-2 after a dispute over late-night food orders. Police have arrested one of the main accused, Kaushal Mishra, following a tip-off. The incident occurred when the trio, allegedly drunk, argued with staff after being refused service. Efforts are underway to apprehend the third accomplice.

title: Bengaluru pub: Bank manager found dead inside ladies' washroom
content: A 31-year-old bank manager was found dead in a pub's ladies' washroom in Bengaluru under suspicious circumstances. Megharaj, who had consumed alcohol and food with friends, reportedly felt unwell and entered the washroom before being discovered unconscious. The cause of death is pending post-mortem and forensic analysis.

title: UP murder: Ex-boyfriend slits woman's throat; arrested after encounter
content: Kaushambi police have arrested Balbeer Singh Patel for the murder of a woman in Sirathu, whose throat was slit. Singh, the victim's former lover, was apprehended after an encounter where he fired at police and was shot in the leg. The murder weapon, a motorcycle, and the victim's phone were recovered.

title: Ex-cricketer tears into selectors for snubbing Samson from ODIs - Watch
content: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif criticized the selection committee for overlooking Sanju Samson in favor of Dhruv Jurel for the Australia ODI series. Kaif argued Samson's consistent middle-order performance and prowess against spin make him a better fit for Australian conditions, questioning the focus on recent form over sustained ability.

title: ‘Speak Kannada’: Woman accuses Bengaluru Uber driver of abusing her
content: A woman in Bengaluru alleged an Uber auto driver abused her and attempted to hit her, claiming the driver demanded she speak Kannada and took videos during the confrontation. The incident occurred after she cancelled a ride, with the driver later blocking her path and demanding money, stating she was being targeted due to her Northeast origin.

title: Almost 14 foot: Largest great white shark recorded in Atlantic resurfaces - Video
content: A colossal 14-foot male great white shark, named Contender, has journeyed from Florida to the northern Gulf of St. Lawrence. This 1,653-pound giant, the largest male tagged by OCEARCH in the western North Atlantic, is likely drawn by abundant seal and fish populations. Researchers are tracking its extensive migration patterns.

title: Hit by EU sanctions over Russia oil - India's Nayara struggles to sustain
content: Nayara Energy, a major Indian refinery with significant Russian ownership, is navigating EU sanctions by boosting domestic fuel distribution via increased rail transport. The company, now solely sourcing crude from Russia, faces challenges securing export markets and processing international payments.

title: India’s most employable graduates in 2025: MBAs first; engineers a close second
content: According to the India Skills Report 2025 by Wheebox, MBA graduates are India’s most employable at 78%, followed by B.Tech (71.5%) and MCA (71%). The national employability rate stands at 54.81%, with rising demand for business, technology, and IT expertise. The report highlights upskilling, adaptability, and a blend of technical and human skills as key to job readiness.

title: IPL 2026 auction: Likely to take place in December; set to be staged in India
content: IPL 2026 mini-auction is set for December 13-15, with franchises submitting retention lists by November 15. The auction might return to India after overseas editions. Several high-profile players, including Sam Curran and Devon Conway, are reportedly being considered for release. Australian all-rounder Cameron Green is expected to be a major draw.

title: 'Priya Kapur behaving like Cinderella's stepmother': What Karisma's kids told HC
content: In a Delhi High Court inheritance battle, Sunjay Kapur's children from ex-wife Karisma Kapoor accused his current wife, Priya Kapur, of behaving like "Cinderella's stepmother" and usurping assets. They allege Priya presented a forged will to secure a larger share of the Rs 30,000 crore estate, putting the children in danger.

title: Number Of Executions In US This Year Could Be Highest Since 2012
content: Thirty-five men have died by court-ordered executions in the US so far this year, including one early Friday, with seven others scheduled to be put to death later this month.

title: Trump, Who Long Coveted Nobel Peace Prize, Misses Out
content: US President Donald Trump was passed over for the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday despite jockeying from his fellow Republicans, various world leaders and most vocally himself.

title: Israel Says Gaza Ceasefire Now In Effect, Raising Hopes Of Ending War
content: A ceasefire between Israel and Hamas came into effect in Gaza on Friday, the military said, hours after Israel's Cabinet approved a deal to pause the fighting and exchange the remaining hostages for Palestinian prisoners.

title: Venezuelan Leader Maria Corina Machado Awarded Nobel Peace Prize 2025
content: Venezuela's Maria Corina Machado has been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her work in promoting democracy and fighting dictatorship in her country.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Northeasterner: Indian, Until Someone Needs A Punchline - By Vir Sanghvi
content: The racism we casually throw at those from the North East is not so different - or any less offensive - from the racism that Indians face in the West. Yet, we remain blind to it.

title: Chandigarh Police Constitutes SIT In Haryana Police Officer's 'Suicide' Case
content: The Chandigarh Police on Friday constituted a six-member Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate the 'suicide' case of senior Haryana police officer Y Puran Kumar for "prompt, impartial and thorough investigation" in a time-bound manner.

title: 'I Want To See My Home': Gazans Return As Israel, Hamas Truce Takes Effect
content: Tens of thousands of Palestinians were starting to walk north to return to their homes Friday after the Israeli military said the ceasefire agreement with Hamas came into effect

title: Taliban Minister's Message From Indian Soil To Pakistan On Terrorism
content: Terror groups like the Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Mohammad have long operated from Afghan soil. But Taliban has wiped out all terrorists in the last four years, claimed visiting Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi during his India visit.

title: "Have Always Counted On You": When Nobel Peace Prize Winner Praised Trump
content: Despite high-profile nominations, US President Donald Trump's quest for the Nobel Peace Prize fell short today.

title: 'We will prevail': Nobel Peace Prize Winner Maria Corina Machado
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, who on Friday won the Nobel Peace Prize, said she was confident the opposition would succeed in securing a peaceful transition to democracy in her country.

title: China Counters US With 'Special Port Fees' On American Ships
content: China said on Friday it would impose "special port fees" on ships operated by and built in the United States after Washington announced charges for Chinese-linked ships in April.

title: With Gaza Truce In Place, Here Are 20 Hostages That Are Set To Be Freed
content: Twenty living Israeli hostages are due for release from captivity in Gaza under a ceasefire deal with Hamas.

title: Aaron Chatterji At NDTV World Summit: Meet OpenAI's 1st Chief Economist
content: Aaron "Ronnie" Chatterji, OpenAI's first Chief Economist, is attending the NDTV World Summitin New Delhi.

title: Amid Cough Syrup Deaths, Auditor Flags Madhya Pradesh's Mega Purchase Of Banned Drugs
content: Even as Madhya Pradesh reels from the tragic deaths of 23 children in Chhindwara due to a toxic cough syrup, a new revelation from the Comptroller and Auditor General has exposed a deeper crisis in the state's drug regulation and procurement system.

title: Man, 2 Relatives Killed While Moving Mother's Body From Jaipur To Haryana
content: In a tragic turn of events, a man and his two relatives were killed while transporting the body of his mother from Jaipur to Haryana on Friday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The 'Real' Message To Trump And Pak In Taliban Minister's India Visit
content: To Trump, Taliban has made it clear that it is in no mood to rekindle American presence in Afghanistan. And to Pakistan, it seems to be signalling a newfound independence in its policies and activities.

title: Prince William Tears Up While Talking To Woman About Her Husband's Suicide
content: Britain's Prince William fought back tears as he discussed the impact of suicide with a woman whose husband took his own life, in a video released Friday to mark World Mental Health Day.

title: No Nobel Peace Prize For Trump, An Angry President Who Has Been Demanding It
content: It's a distressful day for Donald Trump. After months of the US President claiming to be the most deserving contender for the Nobel Peace Prize, the Norwegian Nobel Committee has announced a "brave woman" as this year's winner.

title: An Audit Bombshell On Madhya Pradesh District At Centre Of Syrup Tragedy
content: A serious mismanagement of medicine stores in Madhya Pradesh was flagged in a central audit report last year, months before one of the country's worst medicine tragedies left at least 23 children dead in the state.

title: 19 Arrested For Illegal Sand Mining In Bengal after BJP MLA-Worker Clash
content: Tension gripped West Bengal's Purulia town following a dramatic confrontation between a BJP worker and a party MLA amid a crackdown on illegal sand mining. Police have arrested 19 individuals allegedly involved in illegal sand extraction

title: Of love and linebackers: The challenges of a college football Saturday wedding
content: the three pillars of autumn in America are the colors of fall foliage, the traditional colors of college football allegiance, bridesmaids dresses, bow ties and bridal gowns . the sun will rise and set on October Saturdays, those days shall be packed with the shifting hues of the trees aroud .

title: Preview: Key conference matchups, Oklahoma's 'Dog Pound' defense and more
content: this year's preseason no. 1 and no. 2 teams have dropped out of the top 25 . this week's slate presents three matchups of ranked teams . the slate includes three matches of rated teams: no.1 Ohio State, no. 8 Alabama at no. 14 Missouri .

title: Premier League depth charts for most popular teams
content: the premier league season is seven games in and the transfer window is closed until Jan. 1 . there will be no more incomings or outgoings unless a free agent can be snapped up . here are depth charts of the best options for the first XI .

title: Tiruchi district police crack Samayapuram dacoity case, recovers 9.68 kg of gold jewellery
content: Special teams arrest 12 north Indians and recover 9.68 kg of gold jewellery and biscuits; the case was solved with the help of police from other States, says SP

title: First smart ‘Krishi Bhavan’ in Kozhikode ready for opening at Panangad
content: Minister for Agriculture P. Prasad to inaugurate the facility, which was completed at a cost of ₹26.55 lakh

title: Microfinance loan delinquencies surged in 2024-25, Bihar performs the worst: Sa-Dhan data
content: Among the States, Bihar performed the worst, not only accounting for the highest amounts of loans outstanding, but also the highest rates of default on these loans

title: International conference on electronics and green energy held
content: ‘The conference featured 10 specialised areas covering emerging research fields in circuit disciplines, namely electronics, electricals and computer science’

title: Kerala government ignores findings of Forest officials to pave way for widening of National Highway between Neriamangalam and Valara
content: The State Chief Secretary has filed a fresh affidavit in the Kerala High Court after retracting its earlier position that the disputed land parcel is an integral part of the Malayattoor Reserved Forest.

title: Remuneration of State Finance Commission Chairman hiked
content: T.N. government recently amended the Tamil Nadu State Finance Commission Chairman and Other Members (Conditions of Service) Rules, 1994, accordingly

title: Alleging violation of protocol BJP holds ‘homa’ in protest
content: Alleging protocol violation and rendition of verses from Quran in a government programme in Hubballi, BJP leaders and workers led by Hubballi Dharwad West MLA Arvind Bellad conducted a ‘homa’ to register their protest in Dharwad on Friday

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: APSRTC union voices concern over rising attacks on bus crew
content: The union leaders urge stern action against offenders, appeals for better passenger cooperation and more buses under Stree Shakthi scheme

title: PM Dhan Dhaanya Krishi Yojana will give a boost to agriculture sector in four districts of Andhra Pradesh, says Lanka Dinakar
content: The districts of Annamayya, Sri Sathya Sai, Anantapur, and Alluri Sitharama Raju are among the 100 ‘Aspirational Agricultural Districts’ selected under the scheme to be launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on October 11

title: One in eight children in south Asia has faced sexual assault, says new study
content: University of Edinburgh study, released at c0c0n 2025, says India, Pakistan and Bangladesh received reports of nearly 4.5 million child sexual abuse materials in 2024.

title: Pulse polio immunisation drive in Kerala on October 12
content: The mobile booths being planned around migrant labour camps and tourist centres will function on October 13 and 14.

title: ‘Avihitham’ movie review: Senna Hegde’s indie rediscovery indicts prying eyes
content: Sans any big stars and propelled by the strength of its narrative, Hegde returns to his roots and sort of rediscovers his ‘indie’ mojo in ‘Avihitham’

title: Students and faculty of Bangalore University stage overnight protest demanding syndicate member’s removal
content: Faculty members and students have alleged that it is common for Mr. Babu to “misuse” the name of the Deputy Chief Minister and use abusive words against senior professors, causing them severe humiliation.

title: Sports weaving into Hyderabad’s leisure culture as turfs dot city; some are open till late night
content: Young students, working professionals, groups of friends, and sometimes people who do not know each other but want to be out for a sport are getting together to play on turf grounds

title: Scientists decode ancient earthquakes using quartz clocks in the earth — Sand Dikes
content: Sand dikes form when a mixture of sand and water is violently injected into cracks opened by ground shaking, after injection, the water drains away, leaving clean sand trapped in the cracks; these sand dikes serve as clear evidence of a major earthquake, says CSIR-NGRI Chief Scientist Devender Kumar

title: Hundreds of devotees visit Hasanamba temple
content: Hassan district administration had streamlined the entry of VIPs and pass holders this year. This time, the administration has arranged vehicles to pick-up and drop-off the VIPs from the Inspection Bungalow.

title: Kerala Police propose National Victim Identification Framework to check online child sexual abuse
content: A proposal released at c0c0n 2025 cybersecurity conference says that once the national database is established, it can be linked with the Interpol’s international child sexual exploitation database

title: Establishing identity of cyber criminals remains a key challenge, says Union Home Secretary
content: Govind Mohan, inaugurating c0c0n 2025, calls for indigenous solutions to tackle rising incidents of cybercrime

title: India's sovereign AI model to be ready by February: IT Ministry Secretary
content: India rapidly scales up computing infrastructure for AI, aiming for indigenous models and inclusive platforms by 2026

title: OBC groups take out rally in Nagpur, oppose Kunbi caste certificates for Marathas
content: The GR allows eligible members of the Maratha community to apply for Kunbi caste certificates, which will enable them to claim quota under the OBC category in government jobs and education

title: Former minister Eshwarappa wants CM Siddaramaiah to clarify his stand on Scheduled Tribes tag for Kurubas
content: He maintained that not only Kurubas, all the castes that deserve the ST tag have the right to demand.

title: Hyderabad sought after for GCCs, became home to 40% of centres set up in India in three years: Report
content: Skilled workforce, infrastructure, policy support set to attract mor. A build, borrow and buy approach best for GCCs to manage the challenge of attrition, says Xpheno CEO Francis Padamadan

title: Akhilesh Yadav, senior Samajwadi Party leaders pay tribute to socialist leader Mulayam Singh Yadav on death anniversary
content: The memorial event happened at the party founder’s native village, Saifai, attended by senior Samajwadi Party members

title: Chief Minister requests Nadda to sanction a national institute for geriatric care in Kerala
content: Pinarayi calls for expediting financial clearances required to realise Kerala’s long-standing demand for an AIIMS at Kinalur in Kozhikode

title: Nobel Peace Prize 2025: Meet the winner Maria Corina Machado - why she got top award
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. title: 6.9-magnitude aftershock strikes Philippines hours after 7.4 earthquake that killed six
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. title: 'Let children celebrate': NCR states urge SC to lift ban on crackers
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Karur stampede: SC reserves order on TVK's plea challenging HC order to set up SIT
content: The plea has objected to the high court constituting a special investigation team only with officers of the Tamil Nadu Police

title: People obsessed with loan waiver, says Maharashtra Minister; admits politicians give promises for poll win
content: His remarks drew flak from various quarters, including the ruling allies, with BJP leader and Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule saying nobody should make statements on the loan waiver issue as farmers were facing serious financial distress in the wake of heavy rains and floods in parts of the State.

title: Nainar Nagenthran slams DMK govt. for not implementing monthly billing cycle for electricity tariff
content: In a post on X, Mr. Nagenthran said the DMK, while in the Opposition, had opposed any increase in electricity tariff. However, after coming to power, it had raised the tariff several times

title: How Assam’s cotton is getting a contemporary spin
content: Assam-based designer Anushka Das is redefining the state’s textile narrative by turning its traditionally heavy cotton into a finer, fluid fabric

title: Union govt. should set up Centre of Excellence for AI in Tamil Nadu: IT Minister
content: Speaking at the Global Startup Summit, Palanivel Thiaga Rajan said Tamil Nadu wants to adopt AI to improve the functioning of the government

title: Gadkari promises completion of NH-66 reaches in Kerala in December
content: Work on the Palakkad-Kozhikode greenfield highway and Thiruvananthapuram Outer Ring Road will begin in January, Union Minister tells Kerala Chief Minister

title: Armstrong case: Madras High Court orders retired govt. doctor to be included in team conducting autopsy on Nagendran’s body
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar, however, rejects a plea made by the wife of the deceased to include a doctor of her choice in the team

title: Kerala CM tells Centre its fiscal policies imperil State’s development and social progress
content: Pinarayi Vijayan says Kerala has apprised Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman that the Centre’s fiscal policies threatened to imperil the State’s development and hobble its expansive social security net

title: ‘Kitchen Mogul’ T.T. Jagannathan of T.T.K. Prestige passes away at 77
content: Mr. Jagannathan was instrumental in turning around the T.T.K. Group and making it debt-free, which he described as being achieved through “a huge dose of common sense.”

title: Andhra spurious liquor racket: YSRCP MP Midhun Reddy urges CBI probe
content: “The poorest sections of society are the worst affected, as they are deceived by counterfeit bottles branded as reputed labels,” says Midhun Reddy

title: Kerala CM seeks PM Modi’s intervention to safeguard State’s finances and drive development
content: After meeting Modi in Delhi, Pinarayi Vijayan says Kerala and Centre will remain in ‘a constant mode of productive engagement’ for national development and public welfare

title: Seating capacity at Kaloor stadium for Argentina football match to be decided after safety audit; experts from IIT Palakkad in Kochi
content: Greater Cochin Development Authority has handed over the stadium to Sports Kerala Foundation to facilitate infrastructural enhancements in association with sponsors of the event ahead of Argentina team’s visit in November

title: SC reserves order on pleas for nod to manufacture, sell green firecrackers in Delhi-NCR
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for NCR States, told a Bench of Chief Justice B.R. Gavai and Justice K. Vinod Chandran that on Deepavali, bursting of green crackers be permitted from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m.

title: Actor Suniel Shetty moves High Court against misuse of his photos on social media
content: The actor, in the plea, claimed that he had a right over his personality and photos, and passing them off without authority was damaging his reputation

title: CPCB reiterates recommendation to fix 150-m safety distance between stone quarries, houses in Kerala
content: The CPCB seeks to reiterate the findings and recommendations of the joint committee in its report filed on March 3, 2023, said a reply dated September 20, 2025 filed by the central board before the Principal Bench of the tribunal

title: PM Modi calls for making conversations on mental health more mainstream
content: The World Mental Health Day serves as a powerful reminder that mental health is a fundamental part of our overall well-being, the PM wrote on X

title: Centre to approve elite marine operations battalion for Kerala, says CM Pinarayi Vijayan after meeting Amit Shah
content: Pinarayi says Amit Shah conveyed that Centre will bear a significant part of the cost of raising the battalion, including training, weapon procurement, and imparting operational readiness

title: Odisha social activist Ranjeeta Priyadarshini had proposed menstrual leave for working women: Santosh Lad
content: The Labour Minister said the Karnataka government’s unanimous decision to give a 12-day paid menstrual leave a year would greatly benefit women working in garment and other small industries.

title: India to upgrade ‘technical mission’ in Kabul to the status of Embassy: Jaishankar
content: India had closed its Embassy in Kabul after the Taliban seized power following the withdrawal of U.S.-led NATO forces in 2021, but opened a technical mission a year later

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea seeking guidelines on suspension, blocking of social media accounts
content: The apex court allowed the two petitioners to withdraw the plea and told them that they were free to seek any other remedy available in law before an appropriate forum

title: Bengaluru rains: ORR, Electronics City sink; city traffic paralysed by monsoon misery
content: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), rainfall recorded on October 9 evening was 5.1 mm at HAL Airport, 3.6 mm at Kempegowda International Airport, and 9.5 mm at the KSNDMC campus.

title: Supreme Court urges Centre to honour its ‘solemn promise’ on restoring J&K Statehood
content: A Bench headed by the Chief Justice directed Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for the Centre, to file a response within four weeks

title: NCSC seeks report on ‘caste bias’ allegations following Haryana IPS officer’s death
content: The Commission, in the notice issued on Thursday (October 9, 2025), said that it had taken suo motu cognizance of media reports about the suicide note and had decided to investigate the issue

title: Supreme Court dismisses plea on cough syrup deaths
content: The petitioner said ‘precious time’ was passing without any substantial steps taken in the investigation by the States

title: Kerala Tourism marks John Lennon’s 85th birthday with ‘Imagine’-inspired post celebrating peace
content: A picture featuring five women artistes clad in the traditional attire of three religious art forms and crossing a road with the tagline ‘Imagine/ all the people/ livin’ life in peace’ reminds netizens of John Lennon’s message about peace

title: Villupuram MP urges Union Finance Minister to continue GST concession on car purchases for persons with disabilities
content: In a letter to Nirmala Sitharaman, the MP said persons with disabilities were earlier provided 10% GST concession on the purchase of cars, paying only 18% GST, instead of the standard rate. However, following the recent revision in GST slabs, all small cars are now uniformly taxed at 18%

title: Bengal Job scam allegations: ED conducts search operations at six locations in Kolkata
content: The ED raids include Minister Sujit Bose’s residence-cum-office in Salt Lake, and the houses of former officials of the Dum Dum Municipality

title: U.S. Ambassador to India Sergio Gor in Delhi to hold bilateral discussions
content: Sergio Gor and U.S. Deputy Secretary for Management and Resources Michael J. Rigas are meeting their counterparts to discuss bilateral issues

title: Zubeen Garg's personal security officers arrested in singer's death case
content: Nandeswar Bora and Paresh Baishya, deputed by the government as part of Garg's security detail, were suspended by the Assam Police on Tuesday (October 7) after multiple rounds of questioning

title: India notifies first emission intensity targets for carbon-intensive sectors
content: According to the notification, each facility must reduce the amount of greenhouse gases emitted per unit of output compared to a 2023-24 baseline.

title: Trump has claimed that he stopped Operation Sindoor using trade 50 times now: Congress
content: He did not, of course, forget to speak to the man who had unleashed the genocide on Gaza - the Israeli PM Benjamin  Netanyahu - also during this time, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Kerala MLA U. Prathibha’s remark on inviting ‘scantily clad’ stars for inaugurations sparks row
content: Speaking at an event, Kayamkulam MLA said ‘when an actor comes without wearing proper clothes, people flock to that programme in large numbers. We should tell them to stop that’

title: Poll code violation case against Pappu Yadav for distributing money among flood victims in Vaishali
content: The case was registered against Mr. Yadav, the Independent MP from Purnea, at the Sahdei police station on Thursday (October 9, 2025) night on the basis of a complaint filed by the district administration

title: AI-powered alerts systems saved over five lakh lives during 2024 Kerala floods, said MoS Communications
content: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) uses the Cell Broadcast System (CBS) to send emergency alerts during disasters like floods, cyclones, or earthquakes.

title: Police told to take strict action against lawbreakers: Ajit Pawar on row over gangster Ghaywal
content: I have given clear instructions to the Pune Police Commissioner to take the strongest action against those who try to violate the rules and take the law into their own hands, says Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar

title: Conrad Sangma's NPP played role in destroying Manipur's stability, alleges Congress
content: Since 2017, the BJP and its ally NPP have played a major role in destroying the stability and spirit of the State — truly, BJP and NPP are two faces of the same coin, says Manipur Congress president Keisham Meghachandra

title: Karur stampede hearing updates: SC reserves order on plea filed by TVK, others challenging HC order to set up SIT
content: TVK has urged that a ‘pre-planned conspiracy by certain miscreants to create trouble at the site of the rally cannot be ruled out.’

title: Fight to protect Chelam Hill gets stronger in northern Andhra Pradesh
content: APGENCO’s proposed 3,200 MW supercritical coal-based thermal power project in the hill range is facing strong opposition from the forest-dependent Savara and Jatapu tribal communities. T. Appala Naidu explores the dynamics at one of the most fertile regions in northern Andhra Pradesh, where local tribal communities are preparing to fight against environmental disruption they fear will be caused by the project

title: SIM-phony of scams: ordinary homes, extraordinary crimes in Hyderabad
content: Behind the hum of kitchens, chatter of tea stalls and the calm of ordinary streets, tiny SIM boxes blink in silent rhythm, channeling international calls and powering ‘digital arrest’ scams that drain crores from victims across India. Lavpreet Kaur peels back the curtain on how lax telecom checks, fragile banking systems and clever criminal networks transform everyday spaces into nerve centres of high-tech deception

title: BJP workers clash with police in Palakkad over Sabarimala gold-plating row
content: BJP State vice-president B. Gopalakrishnan and Palakkad east district president Prasanth Sivan led the march; Mahila Morcha workers too joined the protest by raising Ayyappa slogans.

title: Vizag Junior Lit Fest 2025: Registrations open for two days of stories and fun for young readers
content: Vizag Junior Lit Fest, a two-day celebration of stories, creativity and conversations, to be held in November with registrations for sessions opening on October 11

title: Karur police detain Salem district secretary of TVK
content: A case was registered against TVK workers for allegedly assaulting a private ambulance driver during the Karur stampede

title: Jagan demands a rollback on move to ‘privatise’ medical colleges in Andhra Pradesh
content: The YSRCP chief accuses Naidu of halting the works at ten medical colleges by issuing a stop memo in September 2024

title: Bihar Assembly Election LIVE: Filing of nomination papers for first phase begins
content: Candidates can file their nomination papers till October 17, and the scrutiny of such documents will be held on the next day, according to a notification.

title: Official crime data does not reflect women’s ordeal in Manipur 2023 conflict
content: Data show a spike in criminal activity in the State in 2023, but a drop in reported crimes against women during the conflict

title: Buffering Karnataka’s waterbodies
content: In the recently concluded monsoon session, the Karnataka government introduced the Karnataka Tank Conservation and Development Authority (Amendment) Bill, 2025, which amends the 2014 Act to define graded buffer zones around tanks based on their size. While there is no universally accepted definition of buffer zones, in many countries they are designated areas around waterbodies intended to minimise the negative impacts of human settlements, The Hindu reports.

title: Coldrif cough syrup banned in Bengal after child deaths linked to it in Madhya Pradesh
content: "The batch linked to the Madhya Pradesh incident has not entered West Bengal, but as a precautionary measure, we have informed all sellers to stop its sale," BCDA secretary Prithwi Basu said.

title: Haryana IPS officer’s death: IAS officer wife flags lapses in FIR
content: In a letter to Chandigarh Police SSP Kanwardeep Kaur, Amneet P Kumar, a senior IAS officer, sought that “diluted sections of the SC/ST Act” that have been added in the FIR should be amended
